event.title: was inhabited for thousands of years

data.event: Archaeological excavations at the Citico site suggest the area was inhabited for thousands of years before the arrival of European settlers.

event.title: uncovered from the Icehouse Bottom site near Vonore date to as early as 7500 B.C.

data.event: Artifacts uncovered from the Icehouse Bottom site near Vonore date to as early as 7500 B.C., during the Archaic period.

event.title: was built by the British in 1756

data.event: Fort Loudoun was built by the British in 1756 as part of an agreement with the Cherokee.

event.title: soured between the British and Cherokee in 1760

data.event: After relations soured between the British and Cherokee in 1760, the Cherokee laid siege to the fort, and killed most of its garrison.

Monroe County was established in 1819 after the signing of the Calhoun Treaty, in which the Cherokee relinquished claims to lands stretching from the Little Tennessee River south to the Hiwassee River.
